titleInfo.title: Bill of sale for Betty, an enslaved woman, and her two sons, in Williamson County, Tennessee, from Francis T. Reid to William Harrison, Jr., 1843 January 25

mods.identifier: HHC - f2, front - slave bill 1843; HHC - f2, verso - slave bill 1843

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: A bill of sale from Williamson County, Tennessee documenting the transfer of Betty, an enslaved woman, about twenty one years of age, and her two children, Louis-Randolph about age four, and William Henry about twelve months old, from Francis T. Reid to William Harrison, Jr. for the sum of eight hundred dollars, dated Jan. 25, 1843. The document was witnessed by Lemuel B. McConnico, County Clerk of Williamson County, Tennessee. The document was recorded by J.R. Hunter, Register, on Jan. 27, 1843. Forms part of the Harrison House collection. 1 document : b & w ; 20 x 20 cm.
